Strompris¶

Fetch data from https://www.hvakosterstrommen.no/strompris-api and visualize it.

Assignment 5

strompris.fetch_day_prices(date: Optional[date] = None, location: str = 'NO1') → DataFrame¶

Fetch one day of data for one location from hvakosterstrommen.no API.

Parameters:

  • date (-) – The date for which to fetch prices. If None, the current date is used.

  • location (-) – The location for which to fetch prices. Defaults to “NO1”.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the fetched data with columns:

  • ’NOK_per_KWh’ (float): The price in Norwegian Krone per kilowatt-hour.

  • ’time_start’ (datetime): The start time of the corresponding period.

  • ’location_code’: Code for location (NO1, NO2, …)

  • ’location’: Name of location, derived from location_code

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

strompris.fetch_prices(end_date: Optional[date] = None, days: int = 7, locations: list[str] = ('NO1', 'NO2', 'NO3', 'NO4', 'NO5')) → DataFrame¶

Fetch prices for multiple days and locations into a single DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • end_date (-) – The end date for fetching prices. Defaults to the current date.

  • days (-) – The number of days to fetch prices for. Defaults to 7 days.

  • locations (-) – A list of location codes for which to fetch prices. Defaults to all locations.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing prices for multiple days and locations.

Return type:

  • pd.DataFrame

strompris.plot_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plot energy prices over time.

Parameters:

df (-) – The DataFrame containing the price data.

Returns:

An Altair chart object displaying the energy prices over time.

  • x-axis: time_start (datetime)

  • y-axis: NOK_per_kWh (float)

  • The chart includes interactive features:

    • Points are displayed on the lines.

    • Legends allow for the selection of specific locations.

    • Tooltips provide detailed information on data points.

Return type:

  • alt.Chart

strompris.plot_daily_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plot the daily average price.

Parameters:

df (-) – The DataFrame containing the price data.

Returns:

An Altair chart object displaying the daily average energy prices.

Return type:

  • alt.Chart

strompris.plot_activity_prices(df: DataFrame, activity: str = 'shower', minutes: float = 10) → Chart¶

Plot price for one activity by name, given a data frame of prices, and its duration in minutes.

Parameters:

  • df (-) – The DataFrame containing the price data.

  • activity (-) – Activity to plot price for.

  • minutes (-) – Minutes to plot price for.

Returns:

An Altair chart object displaying the daily average energy prices.

Return type:

  • alt.Chart

strompris.plot_activity_mean_price(df: DataFrame, activity: str = 'shower', minutes: float = 10) → Chart¶

Plot a horizontal line representing the mean price of a specific activity.

Parameters:

  • df (-) – Input DataFrame containing electricity consumption data.

  • activity (-) – Name of the activity for which to calculate the mean price.

  • minutes (-) – Duration of the activity in minutes.

Returns:

Altair Chart object representing the plot.

Return type:

  • alt.Chart

strompris.get_date(date_obj: Optional[datetime] = None) → tuple[str, str, str]¶

Get the formatted date in the format of four-digit year, two-digit month, and two-digit day.

Parameters:

  • date_obj (-) – A datetime.date object. If provided, the function

  • otherwise (will format this date;) –

  • used. (the current date will be) –

Returns:

A tuple containing the formatted year, month, and day as strings.

Return type:

  • tuple

strompris.calculate_price(df: DataFrame, activity: str, minutes: float) → DataFrame¶

Calculate the price for a specific activity over time.

Parameters:

  • df (-) – The DataFrame containing the price data.

  • activity (-) – The name of the activity for which to calculate the price.

  • minutes (-) – The duration of the activity in minutes.

Returns:

A new DataFrame containing columns for activity, time_start, location, and price.

Return type:

  • pd.DataFrame

strompris.add_currencies(dataframe: DataFrame) → DataFrame¶

Adds columns to the provided DataFrame for equivalent prices in USD and EUR.

Parameters:

dataframe (-) – The input DataFrame containing a column “NOK_per_kWh” with prices in Norwegian Krone.

Returns:

The updated DataFrame with additional columns “USD_per_kWh” and “EUR_per_kWh” representing equivalent prices in US Dollars and Euros, respectively.

Return type:

  • pd.DataFrame

strompris.main()¶

Allow running this module as a script for testing.
